artist: Artist: Ogata Gekkō; Publisher: Sekiguchi Masajirō
creditline: Gift from the collection of Edith and the late John Payne
description: vertical ōban triptych; triptych forming a single image; battle scene; large view of a soldier in a black uniform, holding a waving flag in right and center sheets; soldier rests foot on a fallen figure, with a purple and green flag on ground beneath figure; storming soldiers on left, intercepting with other figures in colorful uniforms, partially obscured by plumes of white smoke; gray stone wall on right image
inscription: on left sheet, on back, in LLC, in pencil: 5650 | on center sheet, on back, in LLC, in pencil: 5650 | on right sheet, on back, in LLC, in pencil: 5650
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
title: Colonel Satō, Dashing Forward in a Campaign during the Fierce Battle at Niuzhuang Fortress Using the Regimental Banner as a Cane
